metadata.title: CVE-2019-14615 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient control flow in certain data structures for some Intel(R)Processors with Intel(R) Processor Graphics may allow an unauthenticateduser to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-76-generic - 4.15.0-76.86
linux-image-4.15.0-76-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-76.86
linux-image-4.15.0-76-lowlatency - 4.15.0-76.86
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-76-generic - 4.15.0-76.86
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-76-lowlatency - 4.15.0-76.86
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-28-generic - 5.3.0-28.30~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-28.30~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-28-lowlatency - 5.3.0-28.30~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-28-lowlatency - 5.3.0-28.30~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-76.86').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-28.30~18.04.1').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.77').
linux-oem-osp1 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1037.42').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.60').

linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1032.34').
linux-azure-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1010.11~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1031.32').
linux-gcp-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1012.13~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.55').

linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.78').
